content.description: Let random variable <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the age of the attendees at a local concert. The following histogram shows the probability distribution of the random variable <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></math>.
content.question: Alfonso claims that the distribution of <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></math> is symmetric with a mean age of 36. Does the histogram support Alfonsoâ€™s claim?

choices.label: Yes, the distribution is symmetric with a mean age of 36.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with a mean age of 36.
No, the distribution is skewed to the right with a mean age greater than 36.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with a mean age of 36.
No, the distribution is skewed to the left with a mean age greater than 36.

content.answer: No, the distribution is skewed to the left with a mean age greater than 36.
